timeline.headline: Palo Alto Co-op Summer 2015
timeline.text: Intern on the AdTech team at A9.com

date.headline: Move in!
date.text: First day in California! The weather is amazing.

date.headline: San Francisco day trip
date.text: Met up with Brian first and we took the Caltrain to downtown San Francisco. Weather is perfect. Pretty big SF Giants game going on, AT&T park is packed. Ziggy's Burgers for lunch, afternoon snack at Nook Cafe on Nob Hill, Avengers at AMC Metreon 16, and dinner at Chipotle.

date.headline: First day at work!
date.text: A lot more snacks than I was lead to believe. Office is pretty nice, at least the lobby area. Technical setup and HR briefing, then team lunch at Nola. The other office, 265 Lytton Avenue is realllyyyy nice. Setting up desktop and laptop + starting the intern bootcamp course.

date.headline: Intern breakfast and orientation
date.text: Breakfast pastries from La Boulange. Played an 'ice breaker' game followed by a few presentations from HR.

date.headline: Cinco de Mayo party
date.text: A9 celebrates Cinco de Mayo party. Tacos and churros and lava cakes.

date.headline: Afternoon run around the neighbourhood
date.text: First time running outside in a long time...

date.headline: San Francisco again to correct my Visa
date.text: Customs officer placed me on the B2 visa instead of the J1. Went to San Francisco early in the morning to a US CBP Deferred Inspection Office. Met Sumit in the office and took the Caltrain back south with him.

asset.caption: View from the Customs Border Protection office

date.headline: Sushirrito lunch!
date.text: A9 Waterloo interns get Sushirrito for lunch.

date.headline: Running at Stanford with A9 interns
date.text: Ran with Brian and Vivian. Stanford is beautiful. Had dinner at Local Union 271 with Brian.

date.headline: Badminton with mentor at Synergy Badminton Club
date.text: Hongyu drove Brian and I to Synergy after work. We had Steam on University Avenue for dinner and bubble tea at T4 afterwards.

date.headline: Lunch at Bangkok Cuisine on Lytton Avenue with A9 interns
date.text: Not bad, but picked something from the Chef's recommendations and paid twice as much as everyone else.

date.headline: Dinner at Sam's Chowder House and bubble tea at T4
date.text: Went with Brian and Jacky. The chowder was not bad, bubble tea was really good.

date.headline: Another day trip to San Francisco
date.text: Lunch at Brioche Bakery with Michelle and visited Coit Tower. Met up with the rest of the group there and went to Pier 39. Had In-N-Out burger for dinner and finally went to Lombard Street. Caltrain broke down on the way back and we were waiting for our Uber to pick us up when they fixed it. Poor Uber driver. Met a couple friendly Stanford freshmen because of this.

date.headline: Morning run
date.text: Ran to Mitchell Park and back.

date.headline: Visiting Stanford again
date.text: Weather was good as usual.

date.headline: Got my bike! Biked from the Nvidia campus to A9, 16 miles
date.text: Decided to get my bike today. Was supposed to bike along the north shore but some person mistakenly told me that I was biking north when I was actually heading south. Got to A9 at 7:50 pm and met up with Brian. Had dinner at Crepevine and then bubbletea again at T4. Biked home and legs were killing me afterwards.

date.headline: Evening badminton
date.text: Badminton with Brian and Michelle. Dinner at Rangoon Ruby, Burmese cuisine, with Brian.

date.headline: Running at Stanford with A9 interns (part 2)
date.text: More people came this time. Vivian, Jacky, and Dino. Didn't run for too long cause people got tired so we walked around campus for most of the time.

date.headline: Lunch with A9 interns at Darbar Indian Cuisine
date.text: Wanted to go to the vegan Chinese restaurant but the owners were arguing and ignored all patrons. It was actually storming today :O Food was OK, restaurant was buffet style with lots of curry as usual.

date.headline: Board games night in A9
date.text: Played Hanabi with Brian, Jacky, An Ni, and Dino. We're not good at it and the biggest cheaters. Not too many other people showed up, one other full timer and a mother and child that aren't from A9.

date.headline: Downtown San Jose for SSN
date.text: Went with Brian in the morning to San Jose to apply for an SSN. Saw that The Piano Guys were playing there tomorrow :(

date.headline: Cafe 220 lunch on the 130 4th floor patio
date.text: All 6 Waterloo interns went :D Lamb and beef gyro plate... should've gotten the salad version instead.

date.headline: Biked up Kings Mountain Road
date.text: Biked up 1600 feet in 5 miles with Michelle. Met up at the Menlo Park Caltrain station at 10:30 am and reached the south parking lot of Purisima Creek Redwoods at 1 pm. Never consistently biked uphill for such a long distance in my life. Hiked the Purisima Creek trail for 1.6 miles before heading into Craig Britton trail for another couple miles. Hiked till 4 pm before heading back to Menlo Park. Dinner at Steam and then bubble tea.

date.headline: Lunch at Pluto's
date.text: The salad was pretty good. The place is super busy at lunch.

date.headline: Second intern breakfast, 18 or 19 interns joined this week
date.text: Free pastry breakfast... ate 7 pieces or something... Played A9 bingo to get to know each other. All the new interns are from really good schools in the States (Carnegie Mellon, Harvard, etc), so many grad students.

date.headline: Biked to the Bay Trail by Casey Forebay
date.text: Decided to go biking for a bit after work. The sloughs are really scenic and calm.

date.headline: Lunch on the 130 building patio
date.text: Didn't buy anything, had frozen pizza and fruits and nuts from the kitchens. Jacky ate salad again -.- Met a couple of the new interns, one's a machine learning Master's student from Carnegie Mellon. We baked some of the frozen cookie dough in the fridge for the first time. Turned out really good!

date.headline: Dinner at Umami Burger before rock climbing
date.text: Dinner with Anni, Brian, Jacky, and Dino. Burger was pretty small for its price but tasted amazing :o The meat was cooked really well and the housemade sauces are super good too.

date.headline: Rock climbing at Planet Granite in Sunnyvale
date.text: First time rock climbing for several years. Took a belay lesson before partnering with Jacky and trying out some walls. We tried out 4 walls before we had to leave to catch the last Caltrain, wish we had more time.

date.headline: Board games night again!
date.text: Got dinner from La Boulange, some sandwich. Played Revolution and then Smash Up. Revolution's super fun.

date.headline: Lunch at Garden Fresh Chinese Vegan Cuisine
date.text: Had lunch with Brian, Jacky, Dino, Tomo, and the other intern that sits behind Jacky. Both interns are undergraduate Berkley students. Really cool guys. The dish was nice, mine had vegan ham that tasted nothing like ham, exactly like tofu. The vegan fried chicken though, tasted so much like chicken.

date.headline: AXP team mini gold event at Golfland USA
date.text: Pretty fun, lots of little kids there and we're a group of mostly 30 and 40 year olds. Won a free round of mini golf by getting a hole in one on the 19th bonus hole :D

date.headline: Biked to Alviso Marina County Park and back!
date.text: Biked with Michelle and Dino. The bike there was super nice, weather was perfect and the view was great! Got to the park, hiked around and came back. Michelle found out she left her keys in the morning at the Caltrain station :( Biked back, first to Castro Street in Mountain View for bubble tea at Tea Era and then ramen at Maru Ichi.

date.headline: Golden Gate Park and Twin Peaks in San Francisco
date.text: Met up with Vivian in the San Francisco Caltrain station before heading to Adrian's place. Went to lunch at New Nagano Sushi. I thought it was pretty mediocre, the rolls were untidy and not circular. Went to the Golden Gate Park after, first stop at the Japanese Tea Garden. Then we went to the Bison Paddock in the Park. Met up with Oscar and Karim there. Went to Twin Peaks afterwards. We stopped by Flywheel Coffee Roasters for some coffee and hot chocolate. Weather was super cloudy and foggy on Twin Peaks. It was also SUPER windy and wet on the peak. Really awesome experience still even though we couldn't really see anything.

date.headline: Cooking at Michelle's place with Dino
date.text: Made pull apart cheese and garlic crack bread, guac, and awesome burgers! :D

date.headline: Crepevine for lunch with A9 interns
date.text: 10 of us came. Super good food, great company.

date.headline: Third intern breakfast
date.text: Free pastries again :D

date.headline: Biked by the Bay Trail again with A9 interns
date.text: Biked with Matt, Dino, Vivian, and Brian to the Bay Trail. Basically same route as with Michelle and Dino but we only made it halfway (or slightly more than a quarter?). Stopped at the bridge that led to the gravel path and biked directly south to Castro Street for dinner. Dinner at Ramen House Ryowa.

date.headline: Toastmasters meeting
date.text: Jillian invited all the interns to an A9 Toastmasters meeting (free pizza lunch as incentive). It's all about giving speeches, reminds me a lot about speech com. I'm going to continue going to the meetings :D

date.headline: Third board games night
date.text: Played Castle with Dino and (forgot her name) and her son, "little Peter", her son. Got lucky and won even though I didn't really know what I was doing most of the time. Other group played Coup. Played a match of Coup before leaving for home.

date.headline: Lunch at Pluto's again
date.text: A whole bunch of A9 interns decided to go get Sushirrito. The line was super long at Sushirrito so Jacky and I decided to go to Pluto's instead. Everyone followed afterwards cause the line at Sushiritto was too long. Got a sandwich instead of a salad this time :D

date.headline: Googleplex for dinner and Mad Max at Cinemark Century Cinema 16
date.text: Biked with Jacky, Vivian, Brian, Dino, and Matt to the Googleplex through the Bay Trail again. Met Chris Mitcheltree and his friend (forgot her name, from Vancouver :o) there and had dinner at Cafe Moma. Google bikes are bad but can be useful sometimes. Went to the theatre afterwards for Mad Max. The theatre was amazing, seats were super spacious and reclining. The movie was amazing, just as good as the ratings suggest. Biked back with Matt and Jacky to Palo Alto.

date.headline: Biking trip in San Francisco and Sausilito
date.text: Met up with Matt at the Palo Alto Caltrain Station. We brought our bikes. Got to the San Francisco station and met up with Adrian. Adrian had to bus to the bike rental store so we decided to bike there to meet him. We biked by the San Francisco Bay Trail and saw a military ship (small, maybe not even a destroyer?). Oh it's a Peruvian frigate, the BAP Villavisencio. Met with Adrian and biked to the Golden Gate Bridge. So much uphill T_T It was confusing getting to the biker's side but we made it eventually. The bike across the bridge was amazing. Next, we made our way to Sausilito downtown. Sausilito is beautiful. Why do they specifically have city staff to direct and help bikers? :o We had 4pm "lunch" at Lappert's. I got fish tacos (there was cilantro!). Took the ferry back to SF afterwards and biked to the AT&T park just to see the outside of the stadium as a game was about to begin. Biked to the Tacqueria Can-cun on 19th and Mission afterwards for dinner. Coincidentally saw Brian and his friends there for dinner. The line at the restaurant was sooo long, went into the corridor to the washrooms and wrapped around. Best burrito I've ever had in my life. It was a super burrito with marinated pork. Also tried Coke in a glass bottle, pretty good. Biked to Adrian's place and hung out before the next caltrain. We stayed a bit too long and had to rush to catch it but the train, which was supposed to leave at 9:30 left at 10:15 for some reason -.- We had our bikes locked up on the train and missed the California Avenue caltrain stop since unlocking took too long (learned that we shouldn't lock our bikes on the train). Biked from the San Antonio station back home.
